movies.title: Three Tickets to Hollywood
movies.plot: The story of three boys who, fascinated with seventh art magic, decide to escape from their remote village straight to Hollywood. In the same time, a local policeman frantically organizes a reception for the president of the state. His "strictly controlled" citizens, under the influence of events in Cuba, in 1962. start dividing in two parties, resolved to succeed where Hruscov and J.F.K. have failed.
movies.simplePlot: The story of three boys who, fascinated with seventh art magic, decide to escape from their remote village straight to Hollywood. In the same time, a local policeman frantically organizes a...

biography.bio: Branislav Lecic was born on August 25, 1955 in Sabac, Serbia, Yugoslavia. He is an actor, known for Underground (1995), The Professional (2003) and Three Tickets to Hollywood (1993). He has been married to Nina Radulovic since 2010. They have one child. He was previously married to Ivana Vujadinovic.
biography.name: Branislav Lecic

biography.bio: Bogdan Diklic was born on August 1, 1953 in Bjelovar, Croatia, Yugoslavia. He is an actor, known for The Marathon Family (1982), No Man's Land (2001) and Au feu! (2003).
biography.name: Bogdan Diklic

biography.bio: Ljubisa Samardzic was born into a miner's family. His acting talent was discovered very early and he won a scholarship with respected director Bojan Stupica. After graduating Belgrade Drama Arts Academy and playing a few theater roles, Ljubisa Samardzic was given the part in Igre na skelama (1961). After that experience, he decided to quit theater and try his luck in movies. In a few years he got the leading roles in some of the most popular or influential movies ever made in former Yugoslavia and soon became one of the movie icons in that country, together with 'Velimir 'Bata' Zivojinovic', Milena Dravic and Boris Dvornik. In the 1980s and during the break-up of Yugoslavia his acting star began to fade but he managed to switch careers by founding his own movie production company together with his son Dragan Samardzic. The company not only survived the harsh times of UN sanctions against rump Yugoslavia, but managed to produce few successful movies that became popular in many of the former Yugoslav republics. Ljubisa Samardzic now lives and works in Belgrade, is married and has two children and two grandchildren.
biography.name: Ljubisa Samardzic

biography.bio: Neda Arneric was born on July 15, 1953 in Knjazevac, Serbia, Yugoslavia. She is an actress, known for Qui chante là-bas? (1980), Pod sretnom zvijezdom (2011) and Metla bez drske (1989).
biography.name: Neda Arneric

biography.bio: Velimir 'Bata' Zivojinovic was born on June 5, 1933 in Koracica near Mladenovac, Serbia, Yugoslavia. He was an actor, known for Srecni ljudi (1993), Ice (2012) and Joli village, jolie flamme (1996). He was married to Julijana 'Lula' Zivojinovic. He died on May 22, 2016 in Belgrade, Serbia.
biography.name: Velimir 'Bata' Zivojinovic

biography.bio: Branislav 'Ciga' Jerinic was born on March 20, 1932 in Kragujevac, Serbia, Yugoslavia. He was an actor, known for Iznenadna i prerana smrt pukovnika K.K (1987), Three (1965) and Golubovica apoteka (1999). He was married to Slavka Jerinic. He died on June 27, 2006 in Belgrade, Serbia.
biography.name: Branislav 'Ciga' Jerinic

biography.bio: Vesna Stanojevic was born on September 28, 1963 in Kragujevac, Serbia, Yugoslavia. She is an actress, known for Poslednji krug u Monci (1989), Cvat lipe na Balkanu (2011) and Put Ruzama Posut (2013).
biography.name: Vesna Stanojevic

biography.bio: Dragan Nikolic's movie debut was in 1964 (Pravo stanje stvari (1964)), but he started his career with role Dzimi Barka in movie Quand je serai mort et livide (1967), directed by Zivojin Pavlovic and for this role, he was awarded with Diploma at Pula Film Festival in 1968. He appeared in more than 90 feature films. In 1985 he received the "October award" of Belgrade. He was married to Milena Dravic. He lived in Belgrade, worked in theatre and acted in TV series like Bolji zivot (1987) and Porodicno blago (1998). He was regular member of famous Belgrade theatre "Atelje 212" (1969-2009) where he realized more than 50 roles, such as Berger in "Hair" by Gerome Ragni and James Rado, Djenka Djavo in "The Marathon Family" by Dusan Kovacevic, Gavrilo in "St. George Kills The Dragon" by Dusan Kovacevic and The Unknown in "The Visitor" by Eric-Emmanuel Schmitt.
biography.name: Dragan Nikolic

biography.placeOfBirth: Osinja near Derventa, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Yugoslavia
biography.bio: Slobodan Custic was born on May 9, 1958 in Osinja near Derventa, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Yugoslavia. He is an actor and director, known for Kuduz (1989), The Brothers Bloom (2008) and Landscape No.2 (2008).
biography.name: Slobodan Custic

biography.bio: Vesna Cipcic was born on March 23, 1954 in Belgrade, Serbia, Yugoslavia. She is known for her work on Zvezdara (2013), Pokondirena tikva (1997) and Zikina dinastija (1985).
biography.name: Vesna Cipcic

biography.bio: Milutin 'Mima' Karadzic was born on April 9, 1955 in Bijelo Polje, Montenegro, Yugoslavia. He is an actor and producer, known for Komsije (2015), Montevideo: Taste of a Dream (2010) and The Beauty of Vice (1986).
biography.name: Milutin 'Mima' Karadzic

biography.bio: Danilo Lazovic was born on November 25, 1951 in Brodarevo near Prijepolje, Serbia, Yugoslavia. He was an actor, known for Srecni ljudi (1993), Strawberries in the Supermarket (2003) and Stizu dolari (2004). He died on March 25, 2006 in Belgrade, Serbia and Montenegro.
biography.name: Danilo Lazovic

biography.bio: Petar Banicevic was born on February 8, 1930 in Niksic, Montenegro, Yugoslavia. He was an actor, known for La vengeance du faucon (1981), Boje slepila (1991) and Licem u lice u Napulju (1983). He died on September 4, 2006 in Belgrade, Serbia.
biography.name: Petar Banicevic

biography.placeOfBirth: Gornje Grgure near Blace, Serbia, Yugoslavia
biography.bio: Dusan Janicijevic was born on April 27, 1932 in Gornje Grgure near Blace, Serbia, Yugoslavia. He was an actor and writer, known for Zadah tela (1983), Stojan Mutikasa (1954) and Coriolanus (2011). He was married to Jasna. He died on July 5, 2011 in Gornje Grgure near Blace, Serbia.
biography.name: Dusan Janicijevic

biography.bio: Josif Tatic was born on April 13, 1946 in Novi Sad, Serbia, Yugoslavia. He was an actor, known for Underground (1995), Bolji zivot (1987) and The Professional (2003). He died on February 8, 2013 in Belgrade, Serbia.
biography.name: Josif Tatic
